com.camerontec.catalys.util.attributesupport

Class AttributeChangeEvent

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.EventObject
      • com.camerontec.catalys.util.notification.CatalysEventObject
        • com.camerontec.catalys.util.attributesupport.AttributeChangeEvent
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Cloneable

    public class AttributeChangeEvent
extends CatalysEventObject
    Event which can be fired by objects which have named attributes.

    The source object fires such an event whenever one or more of its attributes have changed.

    An event source may send an AttributeChangeEvent with a null name to indicate that an arbitrary set of its attributes have changed. In this case the old and new values should also be null.

    Note:
    This object has the same semantics as java.beans.PropertyChangeEvent. The reason that we do not use that standard class is that we want to subclass our standard CatalysEventObject event in order to inherit its special characteristics and the notification framework built around it.

    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • AttributeChangeEvent

        public AttributeChangeEvent(Object source,
                            String attributeName,
                            Object oldValue,
                            Object newValue)
        Parameters:
        source - The object that fired the event.
        attributeName - Name of attribute that changed. If null means that several attributes changed.
        oldValue - The old value of the property. May be null.
        newValue - The new value of the property. May be null.

    • Method Detail

      • getAttributeName

        public String getAttributeName()
        Gets the programmatic name of the attribute that was changed.
        Returns:
        The programmatic name of the attribute that was changed. May be null if multiple attributes have changed.

      • getNewValue

        public Object getNewValue()
        Sets the new value for the attribute, expressed as an Object.
        Returns:
        The new value for the attribute, expressed as an Object. May be null if multiple attributes have changed.

      • getOldValue

        public Object getOldValue()
        Gets the old value for the attribute, expressed as an Object.
        Returns:
